results.title: Go Bang – PNAU
results.brief_description: Australian dance act PNAU are celebrated for groundbreaking visuals in their live act and music videos, including for their single Go Bang (2017) which featured Kira Divine. The clip creates a psychedelic, cosmic journey through animation, the glow-in-the-dark effects and an aquatic aesthetic.

constellations_primary.name: Go Bang
constellations_primary.description: Australian dance act PNAU are renowned for groundbreaking visuals in their music videos, including for their 2017 single 'Go Bang' which featured Kira Divine.

results.description: Australian dance act PNAU are celebrated for groundbreaking visuals in their live act and music videos, including for their single ‘Go Bang’, which featured Kira Divine. Setting out to create a psychedelic, cosmic journey through the use of animation, the glow-in-the-dark effects and aquatic aesthetic conjure images of James Cameron’s Avatar and the introduction of singing crab Tamatoa in Disney’s Moana.

results.title: Glued to the telly
results.creator_credit: Stuart Menzies, Vixen Films and Jo Lane
results.brief_description: Looks at the history of Australian television and how it has impacted on the lives and culture of Australians. The program provides statistics on television viewing and uses archival footage, interviews and drama segments to evaluate the impact of “telly”.

results.title: Glove puppetry - Scenery and production
results.brief_description: Final film in the series devoted to “Creative Leisure’. The children see the culmination of their work then they assemble scenery and puppets for the staging of their play. The children paint the backdrop and throne; gather leaves and stalks for scenery; and make baskets, fishing line, and table as props before staging their puppet play “Snow White and Rose Red.”

results.title: Glove puppetry - Painting and dressing
results.brief_description: Children paint and dress their own puppets at the Brisbane Creative Leisure Centre. The puppets being to come to life as colourful expressions are painted on, wigs added, and a strip of glue felted around the neck. Using a paper pattern, clothes are cut out, and then sewn strongly together.

results.title: Glove puppetry - making the heads
results.brief_description: Children make their own puppets to illustrate a story. After watching a play at the Brisbane Creative Leisure Centre children learn how to mould puppet heads onto cardboard rolls with paper pulp. They use paper strips to add features, and finally leave them to dry on strands also made at the centre.

results.title: Gloucester Cathedral
results.brief_description: A study of Gloucester Cathedral; within the building are great circular columns of Norman architecture; vaulting of the nave and choir is rich in style; painted glass windows date from the 14th century; detailed studies of the cloisters and the fan tracery.
results.description: A study of Gloucester Cathedral; within the building are great circular columns of Norman architecture; vaulting of the nave and choir is rich in style; painted glass windows date from the 14th century; detailed studies of the cloisters and the fan tracery.

results.title: Glory
results.creator_credit: Freddie Fields, Tri-Star Pictures and Edward Zwick
results.brief_description: Glory tells the epic true story of Colonel Robert Gould Shaw and his 54th Massachusetts Regiment - the American Civil War’s first black fighting unit. By risking their own lives in battle these men were to lay claim to freedom and citizenship for themselves and their children. Stars Matthew Broderick, Denzel Washington, in an Academy Award winning role, Cary Elwes and Morgan Freeman. Graphically depicts the supreme sacrifice made by these brave men in order to prove themselves the equals of the white Americans.

results.title: Glorious colour
results.creator_credit: Anne James Productions and Anne James
results.brief_description: Glorious Colour is a five, half hour program series on Kaffe Fassett, Artist/Designer working in the threefold areas of painting, knitting and needlepoint. Program 1- Introduction: at home. Program 2- Painting and knitting-studies Program 3- Developing colour sense Program 4- The knitters’ workshop Program 5- Textile Designing-Conclusions
